business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher ahead of RBI decision; Tata Motors stock gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex added 129.72 points to 81,764.53, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.35 points to 25,059.50.

Gold, silver price today, October 9, 2024: Yellow metal records dip, silver trades higher on MCXGold Price Today 9 October 2024: Gold is trading on the lower side while silver rates have recorded a hike on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

US aviation agency issues safety alert over Boeing 737 rudder issueAlert comes after National Transportation Safety Board says foreign airlines could be using planes with rudder components that could pose safety risks
Paytm shares rally 18% in last-hour surge: Is there more upside? Despite the rally in shares, Paytm's stock is still down 24.51% from its 52-week high of Rs 998.30, recorded on August 20, 2023.

More trouble for Ola Electric, transport ministry to investigate complaintsThe complaints against Ola Electric have been growing in recent months, with issues ranging from service quality, customer support, to product reliability.
Sensex, Nifty end higher led by auto and financial; Paytm shares jump 16%The S&P BSE Sensex added 584.81 points to end at 81,634.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 217.40 points to close at 25,013.15.

Tata Group stock falls 4% as Jhunjhunwala eyes exit from multibaggerThe Jhunjhunwala family first invested in Tata Motors in the September 2020 quarter, when Rakesh Jhunjhunwala picked up 4 crore shares of the company

Explained: Why SpiceJet shares jumped 9% todaySpiceJet recently raised Rs 3,000 crore through a qualified institutional placement (QIP). The airline is also set to receive an additional Rs 736 crore from a previous funding round, which will help support its growth plans.

Cognizant favoured H-1B holders over non-Indian workers, says US juryThis case dates back to 2017 when a class-action lawsuit was filed against the IT giant, accusing it of bias in its employment practices.
Crude oil prices seem to stabilise as all-out war fears recedeTensions between Israel and Iran led to a 13 per cent spurt in Brent crude prices in the past seven days.

Stock market reacts to China stimulus: Is there further dip in Sensex, Nifty?Despite some analysts hoping that foreign portfolio investment (FPI) outflows from India might reverse, further declines in Indian stocks cannot be dismissed, as per experts.
Ola Electric shares fall 6% after show cause notice; drops 46% from peakOla Electric has been given 15 days to respond to the notice and will provide the required documents within that time frame.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as global uncertainty fuels cautious sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 321.03 points to 81,371.03, while the Nifty50 added 73.45 points to 24,869.20.

Central panel's notice to Ola after surge in complaints against EVs: SourcesThe Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has taken cognisance of thousands of complaints and issued a show-cause notice to Ola Electric, sources said.

RBI MPC: Is rate cut on card? Shaktikanta Das to announce soonSpeculation has grown about the possibility of a rate cut or a shift in monetary policy, especially after the US Federal Reserve delivered an unexpected 50-basis-point cut in September 2024.

Zepto shifting its base to Total Mall in Sarjapur, Bengaluru: ReportZepto had earlier asked its 1,700-1,800 employees to move from its current base in Powai, Mumbai, to Bengaluru. However, the timeline was pushed back due to delays in finalising an appropriate location.
Sensex, Nifty close in red despite IT boost; global factors weigh heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 638.45 points to end at 81,050, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 218.85 points to close at 24,795.75.

Explained: Why NBCC India shares are falling 30% on mobile trading appsThe company has performed well in recent times, with its shares increasing by 109% in 2024 and a massive 192% over the last year.

Mark Zuckerberg flaunts 'his and her' Porsches, designs minivan for wifeZuckerberg posted photos and videos of a Porsche 911 GT3 with a touring package for himself, and a customised Porsche Cayenne Turbo GT Minivan for Priscilla.
RVNL, IRFC, IRCON: Railway stocks fall up to 8%. Check hereRailway stocks such as RVNL, IRFC, IRCON saw a decline on the stock exchanges on Monday.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: BJP's stunning Haryana hat trick, National Conference's big Jammu and Kashmir winThe BJP surpassed the majority mark in the 90-member Haryana Assembly, setting the stage for a record third straight term. In Jammu and Kashmir, the National Conference-Congress alliance appears poised to defeat the ruling BJP.

The Ram Rahim factor in Haryana election resultsWhen Gurmeet Ram Rahim was granted parole for the fifteenth time, there was a lot of criticism aimed at the BJP, which was accused of seeking the support of Dera Sacha Sauda chief.

Why the knives are out for Congress in INDIAThe twin election results on Tuesday brought back two sore points for the Congress. The party needed allies to climb to power in states, and it failed in straight fights with the BJP. This has been noticed by its alliance partners, and the knives are out.

How Omar Abdullah broke his morning run jinx: Told myself I will never run if...Omar Abdullah went out for a run on Tuesday morning, even as his party was on edge awaiting the verdict of the people of Jammu and Kashmir. But, in an interview with India Today TV, Omar Abdullah candidly spoke about how he almost did not follow his routine – all due to the "jinx" of his morning run.

Rajdeep Sardesai's big takeaways from BJP's Haryana win, J&K resultsIn Haryana, the BJP's performance this year has surpassed its 2014 breakthrough, when it first came to power on its own, and in Jammu and Kashmir, the Farooq Abdullah-led NC led the alliance to victory by winning 42 seats.

Netanyahu's 'take back your country' message to Lebanon amid Hezbollah conflictCalling Lebanon "once the pearl of Middle East known for its tolerance and beauty", Netanyahu urged the people to take back their country, which "Hezbollah has turned into a stockpile of ammunition and a forward Iranian military base".

First Odisha, now Haryana: Dharmendra Pradhan delivers big for BJPDharmendra Pradhan's strategic grassroots approach and focus on party unity have led the BJP to a historic third-term victory in Haryana, securing 48 out of 90 Assembly seats.

Diplomacy can't be done with lies: Maldives's Muizzu mocked over U-turn on IndiaMaldives President Mohamed Muizzu, who is currently in India, was mocked by his country's opposition leaders, who said that his administration had now realised that diplomacy could not be done through "lies and deceit".

Why taking your phone to the loo can give you lifelong problemsWhen you take your phone to the washroom, you are likely to spend more time on the toilet seat. This prolonged sitting can lead to serious health issues like haemorrhoids.

Mayawati blames 'casteist' people of Jat community for BSP's Haryana debacleThe BSP pocketed 1.82 per cent vote share while its ally INLD got 4.14 per cent, the data analysis on the EC website showed.

Haryana election results: How did RSS resurgence help BJP win historic 3rd termBJP defied exit polls and early trends in Haryana and won 48 seats in the 90-member Assembly. Congress, which once looked in pole position to dethrone the saffron party, only managed to muster 37 seats.

Hezbollah chief Nasrallah's likely successors killed: Israel's NetanyahuBenjamin Netanyahu stated that Israel has eliminated the potential successors of Hassan Nasrallah, the Hezbollah leader who was killed in a strike on Beirut less than two weeks ago.

Donald Trump had secret calls with Vladimir Putin after leaving office: ReportAccording to an upcoming book by veteran journalist Bob Woodward, titled 'War', Trump maintained contact with Putin while back home he continued to pressure Republicans into blocking aid to Ukraine.

Haryana Election Results 2024: Full list of constituency wise winnersHaryana Election Winners List 2024: After the huge turn of events, here is the full list of constituency-wise winners for Haryana Election Results 2024.
J&K Election Results 2024: Full list of constituency wise winnersJ&K Election Winners List 2024: Here is the full list of constituency-wise winners for Haryana Election Results 2024.

Congress part of global conspiracy to weaken India: PM ModiWhile addressing BJP workers on Tuesday night, the Prime Minister also acknowledged voters from "every caste, every class" in Haryana and thanked them for their support.

Dhols, jalebis and the frenzy: How celebrations moved from Congress office to BJPDefying anti-incumbency, the ruling BJP secured a third consecutive victory in Haryana, maintaining its hold on power and thwarting the Congress party's efforts to stage a comeback in the Assembly elections.

2nd T20I: Young India eye series win, Bangladesh look for turnaroundIndia vs Bangladesh, 2nd T20I: India secured a dominant win over Bangladesh in the first T20I at Gwalior, taking a 1-0 lead in the series. The action now shifts to Delhi, where Bangladesh must step up to keep the series alive.

BJP's Sunil Sangwan, ex-jailer in whose tenure Ram Rahim got out 6 times, winsSunil Sangwan defeated Congress's Manisha Sangwan by 1,957 votes in Haryana's Charkhi Dadri. His name appeared in the BJP's first list of 67 candidates on September 5.

Brij Bhushan on Vinesh Phogat's Haryana win: 'Power of my name helped her'Vinesh Phogat, who joined the Congress last month, won the Julana Assembly seat as she secured 65,080 votes, defeating her rival, BJP's Yogesh Kumar, by 6,105 votes.

Vocal for local with RSS backing: BJP's 'gotcha' Haryana gameHow the BJP managed to hit it out of the park in Haryana has not sunk in yet for many. Confident of a Congress win in the Jatland, the obituary of a saffron hat-trick was written. The game changed on the final day with BJP taking home Haryana's political 'jalebi'.

Israel shares photo of Iran missiles' remnants: We clean up terrorismIsrael faced an unprecedented aerial assault when over 180 ballistic missiles were fired from Tehran. The large-scale attack, which targeted several locations across Israel, marked a significant escalation in tensions between the two nations.

Hardik Pandya's 'swag' return: RP Singh warns fans not to get too excitedRP Singh has warned the fans to not get too excited about Hardik Pandya's 'swag' return to the Indian team during the 1st T20I against Bangladesh. Hardik played a whirlwind knock with the bat and delivered 4 overs with the ball.

7 killed after Israeli strikes hit residential building in Syria's DamascusAccording to initial reports, seven people, including women and children, were killed, and 11 others were injured in Israeli strikes on a residential building in the Syrian capital Damascus. The attack also caused "grave" material damage to private properties in surrounding areas.

Diljit Dosanjh announces additional Delhi, Jaipur shows, tickets sale starts todayDiljit Dosanjh has announced two additional shows in Jaipur and Delhi for his Dil-Luminati Tour 2024. Tickets go on sale on October 9. He previously performed in Europe and made history in Vancouver.

Triptii Dimri cried for days after backlash for Animal: I got mad thinking...Triptii Dimri faced criticism for her role in Animal, after which she cried for days. She shared that while it was tough, she learnt it's okay to cry to release trauma. She will soon be seen in Vicky Vidya Ka Woh Wala Video.

Alia Bhatt says daughter Raha loves Naatu Naatu: It plays in my home every dayAlia Bhatt, at the pre-release event of the Telugu version of Jigra, revealed that her daughter Raha loves RRR song, Naatu Naatu. She explained how Raha asks her to play the song at home every day.

AR Rahman explains why Prithviraj's Aadujeevitham didn't qualify for the GrammysAR Rahman, in a recent interview, explained why Prithviraj Sukumaran and director Blessy's Aadujeevitham (The Goat Life) didn't qualify for the Grammy Awards. The film received appreciation for its soundtrack.

Mediatek announces new Dimensity 9400 chipset for tri-fold smartphones MediaTek's new Dimensity 9400 chipset revolutionises tri-fold smartphones with enhanced performance and efficiency. Discover how this cutting-edge technology elevates gaming, AI, and photography experiences while conserving battery life.
Lava Agni 3 first sale in India today: Pricing, offers and moreLava Agni 3 to go on its first sale today on Amazon. The device is priced at a starting price of Rs 20,999.

Motorola Moto Edge 50 Pro to get big discount during Flipkart Big Shopping Utsav SaleFlipkart has just ended its Big Billion Days Sale and announced a new Big Shopping Utsav sale in India. The Motorola Moto Edge 50 Pro will be available at Rs 29,999 during the Flipkart sale. Keep reading to know more.

OnePlus 13 to get big upgrades over OnePlus 12, new reports reveal The OnePlus 13 is set to launch earlier than usual, with rumours of massive upgrades including increased RAM and a new Snapdragon chipset, causing excitement among fans. These changes could position it as one of the most powerful smartphones, breaking its traditional December release pattern.

sports.headline: Cole Palmer beats Bellingham, Saka to be England fans' Player Of The YearCole Palmer defeated Jude Bellingham and Bukayo Saka to be voted as the England fans' Player Of The Year for the 2023-24 season. Palmer ended Saka's winning streak of the award.

India's Rishabh Pant will have a big Border Gavaskar Trophy: Shane WatsonShane Watson has claimed that Rishabh Pant will have a big Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia, after making a triumphant return to the Test format. Pant has been a hero for India during their last 2 tours in Australia.

Arshdeep Singh not thinking about Test debut, enjoying highs and lows of gameIndia pacer Arshdeep Singh isn't focusing too much on when he will finally get to make his Test debut and is just aiming to enjoy the game and its highs and lows. Arshdeep has been a name mentioned by fans and pundits to be in the running for a spot in India's Test team.

Oscar Bruzon appointed head coach of East BengalSpanish football manager Oscar Bruzon has been appointed as the head coach of East Bengal FC, the club announced on Tuesday.

Mohammed Shami yet to attain match fitness, Saha returns for BengalStar Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami is yet to regain full match fitness, remaining out of Bengal's squad for their opening Ranji Trophy fixtures.

Australia go top of Group A with comprehensive win over New ZealandWomen's T20 World Cup: Australia went top of Group A with a comprehensive 60-run win over New Zealand. The Alyssa Healy-led side claimed the top spot in the Group A table with their 2nd consecutive win.

Australia tour: India to leave 2 weeks early, play practice game against India ABorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Team India is likely to arrive in Australia two weeks before the first Test, starting November 22. India will take on India A in a practice game before the Perth Test and then face Prime Minister's XI in a two-day pink-ball game before the day-night Test in Adelaide.

Fit-again Harmanpreet Kaur to lead India against Sri Lanka: Smriti MandhanaIndia vice-captain Smriti Mandhana on Tuesday said skipper Harmanpreet Kaur will be leading the side against Sri Lanka in the Women's T20 World Cup.

2nd Youth Test: India ahead after Harvansh Pangalia hits hundred on Day 2India U19 vs Australia U19 second youth Test: Harvansh Singh Pangalia's century guided India U19 to a massive 492 runs. Australia trail by 350 runs, with India leading the series 1-0.

Zak Crawley fifty leads England's reply after Pakistan's 556 on Day 2Pakistan amassed 556 in their first innings, while England's restructured top order comfortably reached 96 for one by the end of a lively second day in the opening Test in Multan on Tuesday.

Manchester United's Maguire confirms injury, ruled out for 'few weeks'Harry Maguire's knee injury, sustained against Aston Villa, adds to Manchester United's defensive woes, ruling him out for several weeks. His absence further compounds Erik ten Hag's struggles in an already underperforming season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
